pageIntro: Short, beginner-friendly lessons on blockchain and the Stellar network. No prior knowledge required.

status.comingSoon: Practice for this lesson will follow shortly.
status.testnetOnly: Use TESTNET only. Never enter real secret keys. We do not store secrets.

import.title: Import progress
import.summary: Summary: {lessons} lessons, {stars} total stars. Practice metadata: {meta}

lesson1.title: What is a blockchain?
lesson1.task: Assemble building blocks (Transaktionen) into a chain
lesson1.learningOutcome: A blockchain is an immutable digital ledger that everyone can collectively verify.

lesson2.title: Understand Stellar
lesson2.goal: Know the differences from other blockchains.
lesson2.task: Send token to friend (Simulation) and view speed
lesson2.learningOutcome: Stellar is fast, inexpensive, and does not involve mining.

lesson3.title: Public & Privacy
lesson3.task: View public transaction and guess whether the sender is known.
lesson3.learningOutcome: Everything is visible, but no one knows the real name.

lesson4.title: Your account
lesson4.goal: Understanding the structure and significance of Public/Secret Key
lesson4.task: Matching Game: What is Public, What is Secret
lesson4.learningOutcome: Only the secret key grants access; the public key can be shared.

lesson5.title: Send & Receive
lesson5.goal: Understanding the Functionality of Transactions and Trustlines
lesson5.task: Execute test shipment and view fee
lesson5.learningOutcome: Each transaction incurs a small fee; Trustline = permission to receive.

lesson6.title: Token & Trading
lesson6.task: Place tokens on the virtual marketplace and monitor price changes.
lesson6.learningOutcome: Price is determined by supply and demand.

lesson7.title: Security
lesson7.task: Sort true/false actions; detect fake tokens.
lesson7.learningOutcome: Keeping the key confidential, storing it securely, and using the testnet.

lesson8.title: Verification & Identity
lesson8.learningOutcome: KYC = Identity verification, validation shows trusted tokens.

lesson9.title: Zero Knowledge
lesson9.task: Example scenario 'I am over 18' without showing birthdate
lesson9.learningOutcome: One can prove something without revealing secrets.

lesson10.title: Practice with SKM
lesson10.task: Create an account in the testnet, activate it, set a trustline, send tokens.
lesson10.learningOutcome: Understand the technical processes of a transaction.

lesson11.title: Responsibility
lesson11.task: Decision Game: Act Correctly or Not
lesson11.learningOutcome: Blockchain is final; due diligence is a must.

lesson12.title: Conclusion / Playful Learning
lesson12.learningOutcome: Review what you've learned, recognize your own progress.

lesson13.title: Multisig for Beginners
lesson13.goal: Understanding the Basic Principles of Multisig
lesson13.task: Compare single-signature (Single-Sig) to multi-signature (Multisig), and look at an example process.
lesson13.learningOutcome: Multiple signatures increase security; thresholds determine how many signatures are required.
